content.rendered:
Andaman Beach Tour Package

Home » India » Andaman » Andaman Beach Tour Package

Tour Overview

Andaman has swaying palm trees, soft white sandy beaches, lovely mangroves, and enticing tropical rainforests. Andaman is an excellent beach tourism destination in India for unwinding and spending time in the many peaceful and unspoiled areas nearby. Andaman beaches are ideal vacation destinations for those who are tired of the constant and stressful hustle and bustle of city life.

Andaman can help you relieve stress and spend time alone with nature and solitude during your beach vacation. As a result, this is an ideal remote destination where you can not only relax but also participate in water sports on Andaman beaches when the desire for adventure arises. The 4 days / 3 night tour will be the best stress relief trip for you.

Andaman Beach Tour Itinerary Package

Day 1 :Arrival at Port Blair and Sightseeing

The Namaste India Trip representative will welcome you at the Port Blair airport (Veer Savarkar) and take you safely to the pre-booked hotel for check-in. Rest for some time in the hotel after which you will go for sightseeing to the places cited below.

Samudrika Museum: This place is under the supervision of the Indian Navy. The various sections in it dedicated to Marine Life, Geographical information, the local people and archaeology. It also has an impressive colorful fish, shells and corals collection.

Anthropological Museum: This place was built between1975-76 and depicts the Negrito tribes of Andaman that include the Sentinels, the Jarawas, the Onges and the Great Andamanese along with the Mongoloid Nicobar tribes including the Shompens and the Nicobarese. This place describes the development of the people by stage and their present lifestyle. The display includes tools, handicrafts, weapons, photographs and other ‘art and crafts’.

Fisheries Museum: This place houses over 350 marine life species. These are all placed on display and belong mostly to the Indo- Pacific Ocean and the Bay of Bengal. It is located just next to the ‘Rajiv Gandhi Water Sports Complex’ in Port Blair.

Cellular Jail: This jail has a historical significance with its construction in the 19th century in the shape of a wheel that has 7 spokes. However, only 3 out of the 7 wings exist today.

Sound & Light Show: You can opt for a ‘Sound and Light Show’ at the ‘National Memorial Cellular Jail’ in which the freedom struggle movement of India is depicted using sound and light. The show is presented in both Hindi and English.

Return to the Hotel for Night Stay

Day 2 :Port Blair – Havelock (57Km)

Early morning on day 2 you will be taken to the ‘Phoenix Bay Harbour’ for boarding either the ‘MV Makruzz’ (1.5 hours) or the ‘Government Ferry’ (2.5 hours) to reach the ‘Havelock Island’.

Havelock Island: This Island has been named after some prominent British ‘Army Officer’. Havelock Island provides facilities for scuba diving and snorkeling. The place is well-known for the transparent waters and white sand.

Once you reach the island you will be assisted in finding a proper restaurant to have your breakfast (in case you decided to have it after the ride) post which you will be taken to the Radhanagar Beach that is considered the 7th most beautiful beach in Asia. You can opt for swimming here or simply wet your feet while absorbing the scenic beauty.

Afterwards, you will check into a pre-booked hotel where you will be served dinner and will spend the night.

Day 3 :At Neil Island

On day 4 you will have an early breakfast after which you will leave this island for boarding a ferry to the ‘Neil Island’.

Neil Island: The Island is named after ‘James George Smith Neil’ who served in the British Army during the ‘Sepoy Mutiny’ of 1857. The island is also termed as ‘Vegetable Bowl’ as its produces high quality as well as the quantity of agricultural products. The only jetty is available at ‘Bharatpur’ serving as the lone ‘entry-exit’ point. This island is perfect for those interested in ‘eco-tourism’ as it provides a wide variety of marine creatures. The well-known beaches of this region include the ‘Lakshmanpur’ beach, the ‘Sitapur’ beach (popular for the ‘red sand’ here) and the Bharatpur Beach. These beaches remain unspoiled and purely natural. One other tourist attraction is the ‘Howrah Bridge’, a naturally formed bridge.

After a full day on the beach you will return to Port Blair and enjoy the changing sky colour in the evening and the sea breeze on the way back. You may even chance upon the flying fish and dolphins swimming next to your boat. Take rest for the night at the hotel in Port Blair.

Day 4 :Port Blair Departure

On the final day you will start with a hearty breakfast after which the Namaste India representative will take you safely to the Port Blair airport/ harbor for you to get back home with unforgettable memories.

Price Details

Tour Name Andaman Beach Travel Package
Duration 4 Days / 3 Nights
Destinations Port Blair – Havelock Island – Neil Island
Tour Price On Request

Chat with specialist who can help plan your tour!

  • +91-971 1616 316

    Holiday Your Way with Namaste India Trip!

    Filling out the information form provided allows you to receive the best budget-friendly customized itinerary in just a few hours.

    • We assure the privacy of your contact data.

    • This data will only be used by our team to contact you and no other purposes.

    Trip Highlights

    • Visit to all the museums in Port Blair
    • The history will be spoken through the Cellular jail visit
    • Travel to the Havelock Island in MV Mackruzz
    • Know more about the Neil Island
    • Also the famous sound and light show at the Cellular Jail

    Package Inclusions

    • All car / taxi / cab service
    • Accommodation as per itinerary
    • Meals as per itinerary
    • Driver allowance, parking fees, fuel charges
    • Pick up and drop off service

    Package Exclusions

    • Medical and travel insurance
    • Any expense of personal nature
    • Monument entrance fees
    • Tipping, phone bills, etc.
    • Anything not mentioned in the inclusions section

    FAQs for Andaman Beach Tour Package

    Q. When Is The Best Time To Visit Andaman And Nicobar?

    A. Because the weather is mild and ideal for sightseeing, water sports, and beach excursions, the months of October to May are ideal for visiting the Andaman and Nicobar Islands. The monsoon season, which lasts from July to September, is not always recommended due to high tidal waves, constant rain, and strong winds.

    Q. What Is Andaman’s Area Of Expertise?

    A. Andaman Island is home to Asia’s only active volcano. Barren Island, about 135 kilometres from Port Blair, is home to Asia’s only known active volcano. Barren Volcano erupted for the first time in 1787, followed by a six-month eruption in 2010. Since then, it has been known to spew lava in minor eruptions.

    Q. What Should You Bring With You On Your Trip To The Andaman Islands?
    1. For sun protection, wear sunglasses, a hat, or a cap.
    2. Sarongs, sun dresses, light shorts or pants, and light cotton shirts.
    3. It’s perfect for the beach. Bikinis, board shorts, and so on.
    4. Comfortable slippers, slippers, and open shoes.
    5. Evening meals should be dressed smartly casual.
    6. Sleeping clothing.
    7. Raincoat or poncho.
    Q. What Are Andaman’s Monikers?

    A. For centuries, the Andamans have been known as Kala Paani due to its cellular jail. Andaman was previously used as a prison central for transporting prisoners from the mainland. This Cellular Jail has become a popular tourist attraction.

    Q. Why Is Andaman Known As Emerald?

    A. This Union Territory consists of approximately 500 islands scattered like green jewels in the Bay of Bengal. This is how the name “The Emerald Islands” came to be.
